RESUMO-CV.TEXTO-RESUMO-CV-RH: Integrante do grupo de pesquisa LEMN (Laboratrio de Eletroqumica e Materiais Nanoestruturados). Integrante do projeto europeu Projeto H2020-MSCA-RISE-2015. Bolsista durante o doutorado peo CNPQ no programa Cincias sem Fronteiras, com concluso do doutorado pela Universit degli Studio di Tor Vergata - Roma - Itlia, na rea de Cincias Qumicas (2017). Mestrado em Cincia e Tecnologia Ambiental pela Universidade Tecnolgica Federal do Paran (2012). Possui graduao em Tecnologia em Processos Qumicos pela Universidade Tecnolgica Federal do Paran (2007) com experincia na rea de Qumica, com nfase em Instrumentao Analtica, atuando principalmente no seguinte tema: caracterizao extensiva e instrumentao analtica (Raman, Infravermelho, DRX, TGA, Fluorescncia de raios X, Granuloetria a laser, emisso tica, etc.).

OUTRAS-INFORMACOES-RELEVANTES.OUTRAS-INFORMACOES-RELEVANTES: A Dissertao defendida para obteno do ttulo de mestre que denomina-se "Caracterizao microestrutural do fosfogesso, visando propostas de melhorias na sua qualificao para aplicao", foi selecionada para concorrer ao PRMIO NACIONAL VALE-CAPES DE CINCIA E SUSTENTABILIDADE referente as teses defendidas em 2012. Esta seleo foi pr determinada pelo programa de ps graduao da Universidade Tecnolgica Federal do Paran - UTFPR em 2013.

VINCULOS.OUTRO-ENQUADRAMENTO-FUNCIONAL-INFORMADO: Researcher member of the project NANO-SUPREMI

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: Tracking nano-bioprocesses using Super-Resolution Microscopy Techniques - NANO-SUPREMI
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: Descrio: Projeto H2020-MSCA-RISE-2015 de cooperao internacional com a comunidade Europeia (Proposal ID 690901) Long-range research and innovation goal: The long-range goal of Nano-Supremi is to develop case studies to enable the advanced super-resolution microscopy to investigate nanoscale synthetic and biological structures and to probe nanoscale dynamic processes. Long-range biomedical research and technology goal: The implementation of Nano-Supremi will allow for tracking nanometer-scale bioprocesses such as (i) nanomedicines cellular uptake and trafficking and (ii) single-molecule dynamic processes of DNA-protein, (iii) protein-membrane interactions. Key Research Goals: The objective of Nano-Supremi is to turn the following creative research ideas into advanced microscopy technologies and services. This will ultimately results in the evaluation of in vitro protein and DNA activity and therapeutic efficacy of nanomedicines plugging the gap between innovative research and its exploitation in clinical setting. Scientific impact: We identified a few innovative case studies to explore the potentiality of super resolution microscopy techniques in solving nanoscale bio-structures and dynamic processes. Impact on early-stage researchers: Nano-Supremi involves key participation of junior researchers with outstanding record of achievements in education and research, providing strong support for the development of their careers. Intersectoral dimension: A synergistic approach in using advanced technologies developed by microscope manufacturers to answer fundamental and applied questions on bioprocesses will be pursued. Interdisciplinary dimension: A complementary research program, ranging from nanophotonics, materials science, to molecular biology and bio-analytical chemistry, will drive the implementation of research tasks towards the full achievement of the objectives.. Situao: Em andamento; Natureza: Pesquisa. Integrantes: Wendel Andrade Alves - Integrante / Francesca Cavalieri - Coordenador / Ariel Felipe Gomez - Integrante / Kevin Plaxco - Integrante / Frank Caruso - Integrante / Giancarlo Forte - Integrante / Alberto Diaspro - Integrante. Financiador(es): European Commission - Research - Participants - Cooperao. Membro: Wendel Andrade Alves; Ana Carolina Domakoski
